Reviews.Content: Finally, a place that doesn't nickle and dime you! I have stayed in that hotel on numerous occasions and it is now my favorite due to ample free parking on the street (once in a while, it's full, but not often) since it is in an uncrowded part of Frankfurt. Although it is a little far from the touristy parts of the city, I've come to appreciate its quietness as well as the abundance of amenities. Free Wi-Fi comes to mind.Breakfast was 18 Euros, pretty reasonable among 3 star hotels, but this Movenpick is a 4 star hotel. The breakfast was absolutely delicious, with mushrooms, hash browns, sausage, wide variety of pastries, juice, eggs, and more.It is one of the newer hotels and the furnishing's pretty new, although a tad bit IKEA-ish. The television offers quite a few channels, including Arabic and British.If you are not driving, I would not really recommend this hotel, but if you're driving, then by all means, this hotel IS IT!
Reviews.Author: klort

Reviews.Content: unless you are working in the fairgrounds... nice but far from everything only neutral from my side because of the very poor location (even worse than Marriott or Marritim)yes it is in the city centre but in order to reach any kind of facility like restaurant or shopping area you need to walk around the Festhalle complex (hotel is behind the fairgrounds and there absolutely nothing around!!!) The nearest area with shops and restaurants is 2km away. From the U4 station you need to walk ca. 500m (a problem if you have heavy laguage).Hotel itself is new (2005) modern and stylish decor even I'd miss a Sauna or Pool for a real 4* experience. We got it for 40 EUR/night excl. BF at priceline which is adequate (not even a real special deal as you get similar rates for low season in Frankfurt around 45 EUR incl. BF) - 250 EUR (normal rates) are too much for this hotel far from the scene!!Conclusion: not recommended even for 40 EUR/night - take a hotel closer to restaurants and shops
Reviews.Author: joe1968

Reviews.Content: Clean, Modern, Enjoyable       Room
Reviews.Author: cheesage

Reviews.Content: Clean, newer hotel; fine for one-night stay As there was a major tradeshow in Frankfurt during our initial one night layover in Frankfurt, it was very difficult to find any reasonably priced lodging (i.e. clean, somewhat comfortable). We ended up paying a little over $200 USD (includes the extra taxes, fees) for the one night stay (exchange rates very volatile this year-2008, so won't mention rate in Euros). This was prepaid, as Priceline requires.The hotel room was large for European standards, and as mentioned in other reviews, the bathroom and the room's modern, sleek look are nice. The architecture of the building itself is not to die for, but it does not matter; its deep red/burgundy exterior color made it easier to locate if you're walking from the train station (it's a good 10-15 minute walk depending upon which route...). At the time, there was a big empty lot opposite the main entrance of the hotel and a circus show was being held. The staff were friendly enough. We did not try the restaurant or buffet as we were in for the night and out early the next morning.However, the elevators are very small; if people were traveling with a lot of luggage, you might only fit two people in at a time. No complaints other than plan ahead and avoid arriving or departing Frankfurt during peak trade shows so you won't have to pay exorbitant hotel prices. That being said, the priceline price was less than half the rate being quoted by the hotel and other travel websites for the same night; neighboring hotels all had increased prices.
Reviews.Author: yong111en

Reviews.Content: A Great Stay First of all, I booked this hotel through Priceline (name your own price) and ended up paying $40 US for a great room. While there are no tourist attractions near the hotel, it is only 1 metro stop from the main train station or a 10 minute walk.The hotel is in a quiet area of the city, near the convention centre. The room was really attractive, comfortable  large with all the amenities you'd expect. The staff was very friendly and courteous.It's been mentioned on Trip Advisor already but make sure at check-out that you confirm your bill - I was erroneously charged 2 breakfasts (@19 euros a pop) for my 1 night stay. It was removed without question but be vigilant!
Reviews.Author: Cat_in_Rabat

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel Overnight stay on our way back to Canada. Easy to reach by subway from Frankfurt's aiport - take s8 or s8 to the main train station, then change to the U4 and stop at Festhalle Messe. Total travel time from the airport is less than 20 mins.The hotel is very modern/new, exceptionally clean with very comfortable beds. Buffet breakfast was included and was very good. No complaints whatsoever. Also had dinner at the hotel and the food quality was excellent although the menu could feature a wider selection. Staff was efficient and courteous. 5 stars!
Reviews.Author: TheBorg7

Reviews.Content: Very comfortable I stayed at the Moevenpick very recently for a Trade Show. It was just a few minutes walk which was a plus. Rooms were a good size with a comfortable bed. Very clean. Everything seemed newer. I stayed almost a week. One complaint was that the walls were not thick so i heard people one evening in the room next to me.Breakfast was 19 Euros. A bit expensive, but Wow i ate so much. The Croissants and Yogurt were the best. I didnt know breakfast was not included. I thought the rate i received included breakfast, but i was in for a suprise when i saw 5 breakfasts and 19 Euros charged.
Reviews.Author: Chrissy444

Reviews.Content: beautiful and professional i stayed one night and thought it represented excellent value for money. i booked the junior suite,which for one person was a little too big even. cleanliness 10/10 staff very professional, design of hotel and rooms excellent. i also stayed at the intercontinental 1 week earlier and room size and quality dont really compare. i will stay at the moevenpick again no question, althought he room at the interconti was also clean as its older it just didnt seem as clean nor as nice as the moevenpick. location a little further from the main railway terminal but still easily accessible
Reviews.Author: AUSGER

Reviews.Content: Really should be a 4 star From time of check-in to the time of check-out I found the staff very professional as well as personable. The rooms were spotless and had all the amenities I would expect of a 4 star. I've stayed at the Marriot up the street on Priceline bids and it too is great, however I wasn't disappointed after staying at the Movenpick for the first time. I appreciated the comfortable bed, the larger than normal bathroom, the water pressure of the shower, the refridgerator that actually had room for store-bought items. About the only drawback is the distance from the U-Bahn station (Festhalle/Messe) in the case of inclement weather.  I travel through Frankfurt several times each year and I would definitely stay here again. I would not be the least bit disappointed if my Priceline bid came back with the Movenpick.
Reviews.Author: ParrotDad

Reviews.Content: Just liked it!       bath room - superior room
Reviews.Author: jurik

Reviews.Content: good location, solid hotel i was in transit. needed a hotel for 1 night. got this hotel on a priceline bid. this hotel is near the train station as well as tram and subway lines. easy access to the airport. hotel is new and very nice and clean. room was on the small side and had only a shower. i would not hesitate to stay here again. perfect for staying in fra overnight to catch another flight. staff was great too.
Reviews.Author: bearkatt08

Reviews.Content: Great Location for the Exhibition Centre Stayed one night to visit the Paperword Trade fair. During the Fair the rooms are expensive, over 300 Euros, but you are right by Hall 3 and can easily walk to the main entrance if you not an exhibitor. As the other reviewers have stated the hotel is brand new and very nicely furnished. The bedrooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are great. The front desk service is very efficient. There is an underground car park which is not managed by the hotel, so you have to pay at a machine without concession. I did not eat dinner at the hotel but the buffet breakfast was excellent. If the room rates are not too high and you need to be at the Messe, then stay here.
Reviews.Author: tomtom333

Reviews.Content: Great, bright, clean and friendly hotel We booked this hotel at short notice for a 1 night stay - myself and wife and my parents, 2 double rooms.We arrived early but were allowed to check-in to the rooms. Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly with advice, maps etc.We paid just 59 euros a room which is unbelievable value for this hotel - breakfast (hot and cold buffet - well stocked) was an additional 15.50 euros each.The hotel is obviously very new, clean and modern. WIFI only really worked properly in one room but that was good enough for our needs.We booked two double rooms, one came with just a shower, the other with bath and shower. I'm sure if it bothered my parents, they could have moved to another room but it was not an issue for them as they prefer showers.Walking to town is not a problem - less than 20 minutes, although taxis, tram and metro are all an option very close to the hotel. The location around the hotel is very quiet. We stayed on a Saturday night. The immediate area houses a large exhibition centre and a number of other hotels. We thought we would eat local and not knowing the area well and having a fruitless 10 minute stroll, opted for the hotel restaurant.Turned out to be an excellent choice. On offer was a hot buffet or full choice a la carte. Both excellent value.We opted for the a la carte and everything ordered was very well presented and cooked perfectly. Being a hotel, international cusine was on offer as well as specialist Austrian dishes (due to the hotel chain origins). We had a mixture of both between us with no complaints at all.Parking cost us 27 euros for approx 25 hours - although we did notice after pulling into the hotel car park there are free spaces available in surrounding street - if you are lucky therefore it can be free.The wife used the gym on Sunday morning and had it to herself. It was pretty small but had the usual equipment and, of course, due to the newness of the hotel, everything was working and clean.Overall, we found the staff, cleanliness and location (as it didn't rain and we like a stroll) excellent. Brilliant for our quick trip to view this lively city and it's famous christmas markets.
Reviews.Author: Happitraveller

Reviews.Content: New and Nice We stayed for one night at this new hotel July 9-10. It takes around 20 minutes from the airport and costs around 22 - 23 Euro. The hotel is brand new and is located in a quite area. You can reach city center by taxi within 5-10 minutes paying 10-13 Euros. We were very happy of its price (85 Euro) inclusive of tax and breakfast. This rate was for a junior suite. The room was very spacious with very modern decoration and furniture.You will find the hotel very quite as if no one else is staying with them!The breakfast was ok and room service as well. We faced some miscommunication with the room service staff when requesting room service. English language training might be a good opportunity.Regards
Reviews.Author: Jeddawi

Reviews.Content: New and outstanding The M枚venpick is is a first class hotel, very close to the sub station, the city centre and Main station is reachable in a walking distance. It is a brand new hotel which had just opened a week before we stayed. We were surprised how good everything was working and especially how personal and friendly the staff was.The hotel is clean and the decor is very modern, it has all kinds of surprises, you can almost call it a design hotel! It was pricey, because of the World Cup and high quality of the hotel, we paid a price of 340 EUR for the two of us, which is a lot for a four star rated hotel.But as we knew it in advance, and the other hotels where as expensive it wasn鈥檛 that bad.We had a problem with the free of charge WIFI so we contacted the reception. A Gentlemen came up, and instead of fixing the WIFI he brought up a cable and installed us a free of charge wired connection, which worked fine and was very fast.There is a large fitness area on the highest floor, with an impressive view over the city, you can even step outside on the roof terrace. Unfortunately there is no pool, which was for us the only thing missing in this hotel.We ate in the restaurant and got a very typical German meal of good quality, and where surprised about the low prices compared to the room rate.To bad that the Hamburg M枚venpick hasn鈥檛 opened jet, so we are staying in the Le Meridien before we fly back home, after some nice world cup weeks.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
